    • Field Detail

      • COPY_TARGET_TABLE_ROOT

        public static final String COPY_TARGET_TABLE_ROOT
        Specifies a root path for the data in a table. All files containing table data will be placed under this directory.

        Does some token replacement in the input path. For example, if the table myTable is in DB myDatabase: /data/$DB/$TABLE -> /data/myDatabase/myTable. /data/$TABLE -> /data/myTable /data -> /data/myTable

        See javadoc for getTargetPath(org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path, org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem, com.google.common.base.Optional<org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.metadata.Partition>, boolean) for further explanation.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • COPY_TARGET_TABLE_PREFIX_TOBE_REPLACED

        public static final String COPY_TARGET_TABLE_PREFIX_TOBE_REPLACED
        These two options, in pair, specify the output location of the data files on copy COPY_TARGET_TABLE_PREFIX_TOBE_REPLACED specified the prefix of the path (without Scheme and Authority ) to be replaced COPY_TARGET_TABLE_PREFIX_REPLACEMENT specified the replacement of COPY_TARGET_TABLE_PREFIX_TOBE_REPLACED

        for example, if the data file is $sourceFs/data/databases/DB/Table/Snapshot/part-00000.avro , COPY_TARGET_TABLE_PREFIX_TOBE_REPLACED is /data/databases COPY_TARGET_TABLE_PREFIX_REPLACEMENT is /data/databases/_parallel then, the output location for that file will be $targetFs/data/databases/_parallel/DB/Table/Snapshot/part-00000.avro

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • COPY_TARGET_TABLE_PREFIX_REPLACEMENT

        public static final String COPY_TARGET_TABLE_PREFIX_REPLACEMENT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RELOCATE_DATA_FILES_KEY

        public static final String RELOCATE_DATA_FILES_KEY
        Specifies that, on copy, data files for this table should all be relocated to a single directory per partition. See javadoc for getTargetPath(org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path, org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem, com.google.common.base.Optional<org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.metadata.Partition>, boolean) for further explanation.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_RELOCATE_DATA_FILES

        public static final String DEFAULT_RELOCATE_DATA_FILES

    • Method Detail

      • resolvePath

        protected static Path resolvePath(String pattern,
                                  String database,
                                  String table)
        Takes a path with tokens #databaseToken or #tableToken and replaces these tokens with the actual database names and table name. For example, if db is myDatabase, table is myTable, then /data/$DB/$TABLE will be resolved to /data/myDatabase/myTable.

      • getTargetPath

        public Path getTargetPath(Path sourcePath,
                          FileSystem targetFs,
                          Optional<Partition> partition,
                          boolean isConcreteFile)
        Compute the target Path for a file or directory copied by Hive distcp.

        The target locations of data files for this table depend on the values of the resolved table root (e.g. the value of COPY_TARGET_TABLE_ROOT with tokens replaced) and RELOCATE_DATA_FILES_KEY: * if RELOCATE_DATA_FILES_KEY is true, then origin file /path/to/file/myFile will be written to /resolved/table/root//myFile * if COPY_TARGET_TABLE_PREFIX_TOBE_REPLACED and COPY_TARGET_TABLE_PREFIX_REPLACEMENT are defined, then the specified prefix in each file will be replaced by the specified replacement. * otherwise, if the resolved table root is defined (e.g. COPY_TARGET_TABLE_ROOT is defined in the properties), we define: origin_table_root := the deepest non glob ancestor of table.getSc().getLocation() iff getLocation() points to a single glob. (e.g. /path/to/*/files -> /path/to). If getLocation() contains none or multiple globs, job will fail. relative_path := path of the file relative to origin_table_root. If the path of the file is not a descendant of origin_table_root, job will fail. target_path := /resolved/table/root/relative/path This mode is useful when moving a table with a complicated directory structure to a different base directory. * otherwise the target is identical to the origin path.

        Parameters:
        sourcePath - Source path to be transformed.
        targetFs - target FileSystem
        partition - partition this file belongs to.
        isConcreteFile - true if this is a path to an existing file in HDFS.
